not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
a splinter (as chipped off); figuratively, rage or strife
to be right (i.e. correct); reciprocal, to argue; causatively, to decide, justify or convict
heat; figuratively, anger, poison (from its fever)
to chastise, literally (with blows) or figuratively (with words); hence, to instruct

properly, a piercer, i.e. an arrow; by implication, a wound; figuratively, (of God) thunderbolt; the shaft of aspear
to sink, i.e. descend; causatively, to press or lead down

above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),

flesh (from its freshness); by extension, body, person; also (by euphemistically) the pudenda of aman
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
strictly froth at the mouth, i.e. (figuratively) fury (especially of God's displeasure with sin)
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
safe, i.e. (figuratively) well, happy, friendly; also (abstractly) welfare, i.e. health, prosperity, peace

the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
an offence (sometimes habitual sinfulness), and its penalty, occasion, sacrifice, or expiation; also (concretely) an offender

4.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)
the head (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.)
a burden; specifically, tribute, or (abstractly) porterage; figuratively, an utterance, chiefly adoom, especially singing; mental, desire
heavy; figuratively in a good sense (numerous) or in a bad sense (severe, difficult, stupid)
to be heavy, i.e. in a bad sense (burdensome, severe, dull) or in a good sense (numerous, rich, honorable; causatively, to make weighty (in the same two senses)
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses

5.brief: to smell bad; figuratively, to be offensive morally
to melt; figuratively, to flow, dwindle, vanish
properly, bound (with stripes), i.e. a weal (or black-and-blue mark itself)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)

as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)

properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
to be ashy, i.e. darkcolored; by implication, to mourn (in sackcloth or sordid garments)
to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)

properly, fatness, i.e. by implication (literally) the loin (as the seat of the leaf fat) or (generally) the viscera; also (figuratively) silliness or (in a good sense) trust

to toast, i.e. scorch partially or slowly
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
flesh (from its freshness); by extension, body, person; also (by euphemistically) the pudenda of aman

the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything

a front, i.e. part opposite; specifically a counterpart, or mate; usually (adverbial, especially with preposition) over against or before
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a longing; by implication, a delight (subjectively, satisfaction, objectively, a charm)

to hide (by covering), literally or figuratively

to search out (by any method, specifically in worship or prayer); by implication, to strive after
